intro: Ophrys × maremmae nothovar. alburnica, commonly known as the alburnica orchid, is a hybrid orchid species native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the genus Ophrys, which is characterized by its intricate flower structures that mimic female insects, a feature known as pseudocopulation. The plant typically grows in calcareous soils and thrives in sunny, open habitats. Its flowers are usually greenish-yellow with intricate patterns, and it produces small, elongated seed pods. This nothovar is of particular interest to botanists due to its unique genetic composition and ecological adaptations.
